title: Court acquits PTI founder, Bushra Bibi in ‘iddat’ case
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 13 (APP): A lower court on Saturday terminated the sentences of PTI founder and his wife Bushra Bibi while acquitting them in ‘iddat’ case.
Additional Session Judge Kamran Majoka announced the verdict on appeals of former prime minister and his wife.
The court said that the applications seeking the opinion of religious scholars and medical boards are also rejected.
The court issued the ‘robkar’ for the release of the accused.
The PTI founder and his wife were currently in Adiala jail. On February 3, the two accused were sentenced to seven years imprisonment and Rs 500,000 fine each in the Iddat Nikkah case. Twenty days later, the appeal against the verdict was filed in the sessions court.
